responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Get the list of available OCSP responder signature verification certificates.
Import an OCSP responder signature verification certificate.

responseMessages.message: OCSP responder signature verification certificate imported.
The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Get an OCSP responder signature verification certificate by ID.
Delete an OCSP responder signature verification certificate by ID.

responseMessages.message: OCSP responder signature verification certificate deleted.
Resource is in use and cannot be deleted.

requesterAddNonce.description: Do not allow responder to use cached responses. This setting defaults to disabled.

responderUrl.description: Responder URL address. This field is required if OCSP revocation is enabled.

responderCertReference.description: Resource link to OCSP responder signature verification certificate. A previously selected certificate will be deselected if this attribute is not defined.

currentUpdateGracePeriod.description: Current update grace period in minutes. This value defaults to "5".

nextUpdateGracePeriod.description: Next update grace period in minutes. This value defaults to "5".

responseCachePeriod.description: Response cache period in hours. This value defaults to "48".

responderTimeout.description: Responder connection timeout in seconds. This value defaults to "5".

actionOnResponderUnavailable.description: Action on responder unavailable. This value defaults to  "CONTINUE".

actionOnStatusUnknown.description: Action on status unknown. This value defaults to  "FAIL".

actionOnUnsuccessfulResponse.description: Action on unsuccessful response. This value defaults to  "FAIL".

items.description: The actual list of certificate instances.

ocspSettings.description: Certificate revocation OCSP settings. OCSP revocation is disabled by default. It will be enabled if this attribute is defined in the request body.

crlSettings.description: Certificate revocation CRL settings. CRL revocation is enabled by default. It will be disabled if this attribute is not defined in the request body.

proxySettings.description: If OCSP messaging is routed through a proxy server, specify the server's host (DNS name or IP address) and the port number. The same proxy information applies to CRL checking, when CRL is enabled for failover.

fieldPath.description: The path to the model field to which the error relates, if one exists.

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the certificate. It can be any combination of [a-z0-9._-]. This property is system-assigned if not specified.

fileData.description: The certificate data in PEM format. New line characters should be omitted or encoded in this value.

cryptoProvider.description: Cryptographic Provider. This is only applicable if Hybrid HSM mode is true.

location.description: A read-only URL that references the resource. If the resource is not currently URL-accessible, this property will be null.

ApiResult.description: Details on the result of the operation.

validationErrors.description: List of validation errors, if any.

treatNonRetrievableCrlAsRevoked.description: Treat non retrievable CRL as revoked. This setting defaults to disabled.

verifyCrlSignature.description: Verify CRL signature. This setting defaults to enabled.

nextRetryMinsWhenResolveFailed.description: Next retry on resolution failure in minutes. This value defaults to "1440".

nextRetryMinsWhenNextUpdateInPast.description: Next retry on next update expiration in minutes. This value defaults to "60".

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the certificate.

serialNumber.description: The serial number assigned by the CA.

validFrom.description: The start date from which the item is valid, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

expires.description: The end date up until which the item is valid, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

version.description: The X.509 version to which the item conforms.

cryptoProvider.description: Cryptographic Provider. This is only applicable if Hybrid HSM mode is true.
